bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 2, 1900

div1.p: Reed writes that he is on his way home to the United States.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 2, 1900
div1.opener:
Camp Columbia,
August 2nd, 1900
No. 28.
Thursday morning. My precious wifie;
div1.p:
This
is to inform you and Miss
Mottsey and dear little big
daughter that old Brer
Rabbit is going aboard
his boat, this forenoon,
in order to be all ready
when she toots her “wistle”
for N.Y., this afternoon-
We will probably leave
about 5 P.M., but as they
are going to take along
3 companies of Infantry
this may delay her depar-
ture till 6 P.M- we will
reach New York Harbor
Monday evening, probably
a day or two ahead of
this letter, & be released
from quarantine about
Wednesday morning, the
8th- I shall then buy
a ticket for Baltimore
& catch the Blue Moun-
tain, so as to be in good
time for a good supper.
No letters yesterday from
my babies, but I suppose
they took the hint that
I would leave about this
time & didn't write. Smart
children those!

Adios! Don't forget
the cabbage & fried chicken
Ditto, hot waffles!
Love & Kisses,
